This shows routine writing practice across different time frames, tasks, purposes, and audiences, which matches the standard.
subject: ELA

question: Which student best shows the goal of writing over both short and long time frames for different purposes and audiences?

answer_options.A: Maya writes a quick journal entry every morning but never works on longer writing projects that need research or revision.
answer_options.B: Carlos spends three weeks on a science report, researching and revising it, but he does not write any quick pieces in a single sitting.
answer_options.C: Ava writes a friendly letter in one class period, and she also works for two weeks on a research report about butterflies, revising it before presenting to her class.
answer_options.D: Tyler writes a story over one week but does not revise it or share it with any audience.

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because Ava completes a quick writing task in one class period and also works on an extended project over two weeks that includes research and revision. She writes for different purposes and audiences, showing both shorter and extended time frames.
subject: ELA

question: Which sentence is the best way to start a paragraph about caring for a pet dog?

answer_options.A: Pet dogs need fresh food, clean water, and daily exercise to stay healthy.
answer_options.B: My neighbor has a big brown dog named Max.
answer_options.C: Dogs can learn many tricks like sitting and shaking hands.
answer_options.D: Some dogs are very small and others are very big.

answer_explanation: Option A introduces the topic (caring for a pet dog) and groups related information together (fresh food, clean water, and daily exercise), which helps readers understand what the paragraph will be about.
subject: ELA

question:
A student is writing an informational report about the water cycle. The student has these notes:
• The sun heats water in oceans, lakes, and rivers.
• Heat turns water into invisible water vapor.
• Water vapor rises and forms clouds.
• Clouds release water as rain or snow.
• Rain and melted snow flow back to oceans.
• A diagram can show how water moves in a circle.

Which plan BEST follows the rule: "Introduce a topic and group related information together; include illustrations when useful to aiding comprehension"?

answer_options.A: Begin with: 'The water cycle shows how water moves around Earth over and over.' Group facts into (1) 'Water Rises' (sun heats water, water turns to vapor, vapor forms clouds) and (2) 'Water Falls' (clouds release rain or snow, water flows to oceans). Add a labeled diagram showing the water cycle.
answer_options.B: Begin with: 'The water cycle shows how water moves around Earth over and over.' Group facts into (1) 'First Facts' (sun heats water, water turns to vapor) and (2) 'Last Facts' (vapor forms clouds, clouds release rain or snow, water flows to oceans). Add a labeled diagram showing the water cycle.
answer_options.C: Begin with: 'The water cycle shows how water moves around Earth over and over.' Group facts into (1) 'Water Rises' (sun heats water, water turns to vapor, vapor forms clouds) and (2) 'Water Falls' (clouds release rain or snow, water flows to oceans). Add a picture of a rainy day.
answer_options.D: Begin with: 'The water cycle shows how water moves around Earth over and over.' Group facts into (1) 'Water Rises' (sun heats water, clouds release rain or snow) and (2) 'Water Falls' (water turns to vapor, vapor forms clouds, water flows to oceans). Add a labeled diagram showing the water cycle.

answer_explanation: Option A introduces the topic clearly with a sentence that tells what the report will be about, groups related facts logically by separating 'water rising' steps from 'water falling' steps, and includes a labeled diagram that helps readers understand how the water cycle works—all meeting the standard.
subject: ELA

question: A student is writing an informational article about rainforests. Which opening BEST introduces the topic and groups related information together (and suggests an illustration when helpful)?

answer_options.A: Rainforests are amazing! I went to a rainforest exhibit at the zoo last year and saw a bright blue frog. It was my favorite field trip ever.
answer_options.B: Rainforests are warm, wet forests with many kinds of plants and animals. This article will explain the different layers of a rainforest, the animals that live there, and why rainforests are important. A diagram showing the layers would help readers understand how a rainforest is organized.
answer_options.C: Rainforests have trees. Trees are green. Some animals live in rainforests. Rain falls a lot. Rainforests are in warm places.
answer_options.D: Forests are important to Earth. This report will describe rainforests, deserts, and oceans because they are all interesting places.

answer_explanation: Option B clearly introduces the topic (rainforests), previews grouped categories of information (layers, animals, importance), and suggests a diagram to help readers understand how a rainforest is organized.
subject: ELA

question: Which sentence best develops the topic "Dogs" with facts or details?

answer_options.A: Dogs are the best pets anyone could have.
answer_options.B: I think dogs are the most fun animals.
answer_options.C: Dogs have fur, four legs, and a tail.
answer_options.D: Everyone should own a dog right now.

answer_explanation: Option C provides specific facts about what dogs have (fur, four legs, and a tail), which develops the topic with details.
subject: ELA

question:
A student is writing an informative paragraph with this topic sentence:

"Spiders are helpful creatures that catch insects."

Which sentence best develops the topic with facts, definitions, and details?

answer_options.A: Spiders are arachnids with eight legs that spin sticky silk webs to trap flies, mosquitoes, and other insects.
answer_options.B: Spiders live in many places such as gardens, forests, and homes, where they catch insects in their webs.
answer_options.C: Some spiders are small and hard to see, while others are large with bright colors and patterns.
answer_options.D: Many people are afraid of spiders even though most types found in homes are not dangerous to humans.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it develops the topic with a definition (arachnids with eight legs), facts (spin sticky silk webs), and specific details (trap flies, mosquitoes, and other insects).
subject: ELA

question: A student is writing an informative paragraph about beavers. Which sentence BEST develops the topic with facts, definitions, and details?

answer_options.A: Beavers are fascinating animals that everyone should learn about in school.
answer_options.B: Beavers are large rodents that build dams using branches and mud to create ponds.
answer_options.C: I once saw a beaver near a river and it was very exciting.
answer_options.D: Beavers are important animals that live in many different places.

answer_explanation: Option B develops the topic by providing a definition (beavers are large rodents), a fact about their behavior (they build dams), and specific details about the materials they use (branches and mud) and the result (creating ponds). The other options express opinions, personal experiences, or vague statements without concrete information.
subject: ELA

question: Which word best completes the sentence to show another idea about the same topic? "My dog can sit. _____, my dog can shake hands."

answer_options.A: Also
answer_options.B: But
answer_options.C: Because
answer_options.D: First

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because "Also" is a linking word that adds another related idea about the same topic. It connects two things the dog can do—sitting and shaking hands—as part of the same category of information about the dog's tricks.
subject: ELA

question: Which choice best demonstrates the skill described in W.3.2.C at hard difficulty?

answer_options.A: The correct choice that matches the standard.
answer_options.B: An incorrect distractor.
answer_options.C: Another incorrect distractor.
answer_options.D: Another incorrect distractor.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it matches the skill described in the standard.
subject: ELA

question:
Which linking word best completes the sentence to add another fact about butterflies?

'Butterflies have colorful wings. _____, they have long thin bodies.'

answer_options.A: But
answer_options.B: Also
answer_options.C: Because
answer_options.D: So

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because 'Also' is a linking word that connects two related facts about butterflies. The sentence presents two pieces of information about butterflies, and 'Also' shows that the second fact adds to the first.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the paragraph about recycling.

Recycling helps keep our planet clean. When we recycle paper, plastic, and glass, these materials can be turned into new products instead of going to the trash.

Which choice would be the BEST conclusion for this paragraph?

answer_options.A: Plastic bottles take hundreds of years to break down in landfills.
answer_options.B: By recycling, we can all help protect the Earth for the future.
answer_options.C: Many schools have recycling bins in the cafeteria.
answer_options.D: Glass jars can be recycled into new glass bottles.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it restates the main idea—that recycling helps the planet—and provides a closing thought that wraps up the paragraph. Options A, C, and D add new details that would belong in the body of the paragraph, not at the end.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the paragraph below.

"Beavers are nature's engineers. They build dams across streams using branches, mud, and rocks. These dams create ponds where beavers can build their homes, called lodges. The ponds also provide habitat for fish, frogs, and birds. By creating wetlands, beavers help many other animals survive."

Which sentence would be the BEST conclusion for this paragraph?

answer_options.A: Therefore, beavers should be protected so they can continue building dams.
answer_options.B: All in all, beavers are helpful animals that create homes for themselves and habitats for many other creatures.
answer_options.C: In conclusion, beavers have flat tails that help them swim and slap the water to warn of danger.
answer_options.D: Next, we will study other animals that build homes, like ants and termites.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it restates the paragraph's main idea—that beavers build homes and help other animals—without introducing new information or shifting to a different topic, providing clear closure for the informative paragraph.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the paragraph below. Which sentence would be the BEST concluding statement for this paragraph?

"Recycling paper helps save trees and energy. When paper is recycled, fewer trees need to be cut down to make new paper products. Recycling paper also uses less water and energy than making paper from fresh wood. Many schools and offices have recycling bins to collect used paper."

answer_options.A: Paper was invented in China thousands of years ago.
answer_options.B: In conclusion, recycling paper is a simple way to protect our environment and natural resources.
answer_options.C: Cardboard and newspapers are two types of paper that can be recycled.
answer_options.D: Next, people should also learn about recycling glass and plastic.

answer_explanation: Option B is the best concluding statement because it summarizes the main idea of the paragraph—that recycling paper helps the environment—and provides a final thought that wraps up the text. The other options either introduce new information (A and C) or shift to a different topic (D).
subject: ELA

question: Which sentence best starts a story by telling who is telling the story and what is happening?

answer_options.A: I'm Maya, and today I'm going to try riding my bike without training wheels for the first time.
answer_options.B: The red bike had shiny handlebars and a loud horn.
answer_options.C: At the end, Maya was proud that she learned something new.
answer_options.D: Bikes are fun to ride outside in the summer.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it introduces the narrator (Maya, who says 'I'm') and tells what is happening (she is going to try riding her bike without training wheels for the first time), which is what a story beginning should do.
subject: ELA

question: Which opening sentence BEST establishes a situation, introduces a narrator or characters, and organizes events so they unfold naturally?

answer_options.A: A mysterious treehouse stood deep in the woods, its broken windows rattling in the cold evening wind.
answer_options.B: Help! Mia screamed as she spotted her little brother struggling in the river and ran to save him.
answer_options.C: Last Saturday, my cousin Leo and I were riding our bikes to the park when we noticed a strange wooden box half-hidden under a bush.
answer_options.D: The beach was sunny and bright. My family and I built a sandcastle, then we ate lunch, and finally we went home.

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because it clearly establishes the situation (last Saturday, riding bikes to the park), introduces the narrator and cousin Leo as characters, and begins organizing events in a natural sequence that starts with riding bikes and leads to spotting the box.
subject: ELA

question: Which opening sentence BEST establishes a situation and introduces the narrator or characters while starting a natural sequence of events?

answer_options.A: The tall trees in the park cast long shadows on the grass.
answer_options.B: I love going to the park because it is always fun there.
answer_options.C: On Saturday morning, I walked to the park with my sister for a picnic.
answer_options.D: Many families visit parks to enjoy the outdoors together.

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because it establishes the situation (Saturday morning at the park), introduces the narrator ('I') and a character (the sister), and begins a natural event sequence (walking to the park for a picnic) that can logically continue in a story.
subject: ELA

question: Which sentence uses dialogue to show how a character responds to a situation?

answer_options.A: "Oh no! I dropped my ice cream!" cried Sam.
answer_options.B: Sam was sad because his ice cream fell.
answer_options.C: Sam looked down at his ice cream on the ground.
answer_options.D: Sam's ice cream melted in the hot sun.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it uses dialogue (words in quotation marks) to show Sam's response to dropping his ice cream. The character's spoken words directly express his reaction to the situation.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the sentence from a story:

"The soccer ball rolled into the muddy puddle."

Which option BEST uses dialogue and descriptions of actions, thoughts, and feelings to show the character's response?

answer_options.A: "Oh no!" Leo cried, stomping his foot. His stomach felt tight as he thought about his muddy ball. "I just cleaned this!" he groaned.
answer_options.B: "Oh no!" Leo said. "My ball is in the mud." He walked over to get it.
answer_options.C: Leo stomped his foot and walked over to the puddle. He picked up his muddy ball and wiped it off.
answer_options.D: Leo was upset that his ball got muddy, so he went to get it.

answer_explanation: Option A uses dialogue ("Oh no!" and "I just cleaned this!"), describes actions (stomping his foot, groaned), shows feelings (his stomach felt tight), and reveals thoughts (he thought about his muddy ball). This fully develops the moment and shows Leo's frustrated response to the situation.
subject: ELA

question: Which sentence best shows what a character says and does?

answer_options.A: "I can't find my pencil," said Marco, looking under his desk worriedly.
answer_options.B: Marco looked under his desk for his pencil.
answer_options.C: "I can't find my pencil," said Marco.
answer_options.D: Marco was worried because he could not find his pencil.

answer_explanation: Option A combines dialogue ("I can't find my pencil,") with a description of Marco's action (looking under his desk) and his feeling (worriedly), which shows both what the character says and does.
subject: ELA

question:
Which word best completes the sentence to show the order of events?

"First, I put on my shoes. ________, I tied the laces."

answer_options.A: Because
answer_options.B: Then
answer_options.C: Although
answer_options.D: Quickly

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because 'Then' is a temporal word that signals the next event in a sequence. It shows that tying the laces happened after putting on the shoes.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the paragraph. It has five blanks.

[1] ________, Liam gathered his hiking gear.
[2] ________, he checked his map and compass.
[3] ________, he set off on the trail.
[4] ________, he reached the mountain summit.
[5] ________, he took photos of the view.

Which row of temporal words or phrases BEST completes blanks [1]–[5] so the events are shown in clear time order?

answer_options.A: First, Next, Then, Afterward, Finally
answer_options.B: First, Meanwhile, Then, After that, Earlier
answer_options.C: Next, First, Then, Later, At last
answer_options.D: Initially, Afterward, Then, Before, In the end

answer_explanation: Choice A provides a clear, logical sequence: "First" signals the beginning, "Next" shows the following action, "Then" marks the third step, "Afterward" indicates the next event, and "Finally" signals the concluding action. This creates a smooth timeline from start to finish.
subject: ELA

question: Which sentence correctly uses temporal words to show the order of events?

answer_options.A: I ate breakfast, and I went to school, and I played with my friends.
answer_options.B: First, I tied my shoes. Next, I opened the door. Finally, I walked outside.
answer_options.C: Finally, I tied my shoes. First, I opened the door. Next, I walked outside.
answer_options.D: Because I was tired, I went to bed early, and I fell asleep quickly.

answer_explanation: Option B uses the temporal words 'First,' 'Next,' and 'Finally' to clearly signal the order of events from beginning to end.
subject: ELA

question:
Which ending best gives this story a sense of closure?

Maya wanted to find her missing toy rabbit. She searched under her bed and in her closet. She looked in the toy box and behind the couch. Finally, she found it under a blanket in the living room.

answer_options.A: Maya has many other toys in her room.
answer_options.B: Maya hugged her rabbit tightly and smiled, happy to have it back.
answer_options.C: Maya looked under her bed one more time.
answer_options.D: The next morning, Maya could not find her rabbit again.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it wraps up the story by showing what Maya did after finding her rabbit and how she felt, giving the story a complete and satisfying ending.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the paragraph below. Which ending gives the story a clear sense of closure?

"Leo had practiced his piano song every day for the recital. He worked on the hard parts until his fingers moved smoothly. On the night of the recital, he walked onto the stage and sat at the grand piano. He played his song from beginning to end without any mistakes."

answer_options.A: Leo stood up and bowed, proud that all his practice had paid off.
answer_options.B: Then the audience clapped and the next student walked onto the stage.
answer_options.C: Pianos have eighty-eight keys and were invented in Italy long ago.
answer_options.D: Just as he finished, Leo remembered he had forgotten his sheet music.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it shows Leo completing his performance with a sense of pride and accomplishment, bringing the story to a satisfying close.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the paragraph.

Lila wanted to learn how to swim. She signed up for lessons at the community pool. On the first day, she was nervous about the deep water. Her instructor helped her practice floating and kicking. By the end of the week, Lila could swim across the pool without stopping.

Which sentence BEST ends the paragraph and provides a sense of closure?

answer_options.A: Lila smiled, proud she had learned to swim.
answer_options.B: Next week, Lila might try diving off the board.
answer_options.C: The pool had a blue bottom and white tiles.
answer_options.D: Can you swim across the pool too?

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it shows Lila's feelings about accomplishing her goal, which brings the story to a satisfying end and signals that the narrative is complete.
subject: ELA

question: Your class is writing a thank-you note to a firefighter who visited your school. Which sentence would be best to include?

answer_options.A: Firefighters wear special suits to stay safe.
answer_options.B: Thank you for teaching us about fire safety.
answer_options.C: I saw a fire truck at the parade last year.
answer_options.D: Fire trucks are red and have loud sirens.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it directly expresses thanks to the firefighter for the visit. A thank-you note should show gratitude, and this sentence matches the task and purpose perfectly.
subject: ELA

question: A student needs to write an informative report about how butterflies grow. Which paragraph shows the BEST organization for this task and purpose?

answer_options.A: Butterflies are beautiful insects that fly in gardens. I saw a butterfly last week in my backyard. It was orange and black. My little sister tried to catch it, but it flew away. We watched it land on a flower and laughed together.
answer_options.B: Butterflies go through four stages in their life cycle. First, a butterfly lays an egg on a leaf. Next, a caterpillar hatches and eats leaves. Then, the caterpillar forms a chrysalis. Finally, a butterfly comes out. This process is called metamorphosis.
answer_options.C: I think butterflies are the best insects. They are prettier than beetles. They are more colorful than ants. Bees are nice too, but butterflies don't sting. Everyone should like butterflies because they are amazing creatures that fly beautifully.
answer_options.D: Butterflies fly, and so do birds and bees. Some insects crawl like ants. Others swim like water bugs. Insects live everywhere in the world. Some are big, and some are small. The insect world is very interesting to study.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it is organized as an informative report with a clear topic sentence, uses sequence words (First, Next, Then, Finally) to explain the life cycle in order, and provides factual information about how butterflies grow without including personal stories or opinions.
subject: ELA

question: A student wants to write an opinion paragraph about why the school should have longer recess. Which choice shows writing that is developed and organized for this task and purpose?

answer_options.A: I think we should have longer recess. It would be fun. Everyone would like it more.
answer_options.B: Our school should have longer recess. First, students need more time to play. Second, we can finish games we start. Third, we will be ready to learn after. For these reasons, longer recess is a good idea.
answer_options.C: Yesterday at recess, I played tag with my friends. We ran around and laughed. Then the bell rang and we went inside.
answer_options.D: Recess is important. Schools have recess. Children like recess. Teachers watch recess.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it clearly states an opinion, provides three organized reasons with transition words (First, Second, Third), and ends with a concluding sentence. This matches the task of writing an opinion piece with appropriate development and organization.
subject: ELA

question: Lila finished the first draft of her story. Her classmate reads it and says she should fix the spelling errors. Which choice shows what Lila should do next?

answer_options.A: Write a completely new story
answer_options.B: Edit her writing with help
answer_options.C: Publish the story right away
answer_options.D: Read the story to herself

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because Lila is strengthening her writing by editing for spelling errors based on her classmate's feedback, which shows editing with support from a peer.
subject: ELA

question:
Marcus wrote this draft about his soccer game:

"I played soccer on Saturday. We won the game. It was fun. I scored a goal. My team cheered."

His teacher says, "Your sentences are short and choppy. Try combining ideas and adding transition words. Also, add more about how you felt."

A teammate adds, "I want to know more about the goal you scored. Was it hard?"

Which choice best shows Marcus developing and strengthening his writing by planning, revising, and editing with guidance?

answer_options.A: Create an outline with an introduction, game events, and conclusion; combine short sentences using transition words; add details about the goal and his feelings; and edit for correct punctuation throughout.
answer_options.B: Combine some sentences and add details about the goal, but do not make an outline or check for punctuation errors.
answer_options.C: Fix all capitalization and punctuation errors, but leave the short sentences unchanged and add no new details.
answer_options.D: Plan a new introduction and conclusion, but keep the same short sentences without combining them or adding any descriptive details.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it shows all three stages of strengthening writing: planning (creating an outline), revising (combining sentences and adding details), and editing (checking punctuation). This directly uses both the teacher's and teammate's feedback to improve the draft in multiple ways.
subject: ELA

question: Mia wrote a story about her summer vacation. Her partner says, 'Let's work together to improve your story.' Which choice shows Mia and her partner EDITING the story?

answer_options.A: They add more details about what Mia did at the beach.
answer_options.B: They fix the spelling errors and add missing periods.
answer_options.C: They write a list of ideas for another story.
answer_options.D: They read the story without making any changes.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because editing is the process of fixing conventions such as spelling, punctuation, and capitalization. When Mia and her partner fix spelling errors and add missing periods, they are editing to strengthen the writing.
subject: ELA

question: Which action shows using technology to write a story and share it with classmates?

answer_options.A: Write a story by hand and read it aloud to the class
answer_options.B: Type a story on a computer, post it on the class website, and comment on classmates' stories
answer_options.C: Draw pictures about a story and show them to a friend
answer_options.D: Read a book aloud to the class without using any technology

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it shows using technology (typing on a computer) to produce the writing, publishing it by posting it online, and collaborating by commenting on classmates' stories.
subject: ELA

question: Which scenario best demonstrates a third-grader meeting the standard of using technology to produce and publish writing while interacting and collaborating with others, all with adult guidance?

answer_options.A: Maya types a story on a classroom computer, emails it to classmates for feedback, and posts the final version on the class blog after her teacher reviews and approves it.
answer_options.B: Lucas types an essay on a classroom computer and prints it to give to his teacher, but does not share it with classmates or publish it online.
answer_options.C: Aria handwrites a story, shares it with classmates for their suggestions, and gives the final version to her teacher to post online.
answer_options.D: Jamal types a report on his tablet and posts it on the class website without asking for feedback from classmates or approval from his teacher.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because Maya uses keyboarding skills to type her story on a computer, which is using technology to produce writing. She emails classmates for feedback, which is collaborating with others. She posts the story on the class blog, which is publishing. Finally, her teacher reviews and approves it before posting, which shows adult guidance. All four parts of the standard are met.
subject: ELA

question: Which choice best shows a student using technology to write, publish, and work with others?

answer_options.A: Write a story by hand and read it aloud to the class.
answer_options.B: Type a report on a computer and print one copy for the teacher.
answer_options.C: Type a story on a tablet, post it on a class blog, and read classmates' comments with teacher help.
answer_options.D: Draw a picture on paper and show it to a friend during recess.

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because it shows using technology (typing on a tablet) to produce writing, publishing it on a class blog, and interacting with others by reading their comments, all with teacher help.
subject: ELA

question: Which activity shows a short research project that builds knowledge about a topic?

answer_options.A: Writing a made-up story about dolphins from your imagination
answer_options.B: Reading a book about dolphins and writing down facts you learned
answer_options.C: Drawing a picture of a dolphin from memory without looking up information
answer_options.D: Guessing what dolphins eat without checking any sources

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because a short research project builds knowledge about a topic by reading sources and recording what you learn. The other choices do not involve gathering information from sources.
subject: ELA

question: Four students are planning short research projects. Which student's plan BEST shows how to conduct a short research project that builds knowledge about a topic?

answer_options.A: I will write down everything I already know about dolphins from watching TV shows, then turn in my list as my project.
answer_options.B: I will choose 'ocean animals' as my topic, find ten books about whales, sharks, dolphins, and sea turtles, and try to read them all in two days.
answer_options.C: I will pick 'cheetahs' as my topic, read two books and one website about cheetahs, take notes on new facts I learn, and create a poster to share my findings.
answer_options.D: I will find one article about pandas, copy three paragraphs from it word-for-word, and paste them onto a poster as my project.

answer_explanation: Option C demonstrates the key elements of a short research project that builds knowledge: a focused topic (cheetahs), multiple appropriate sources (two books and one website), taking notes to capture new learning, and creating a product to share what was discovered. This approach ensures the student gains new knowledge through research rather than relying only on what was already known or copying directly from a source.
subject: ELA

question: Marcus wants to learn about rainforest animals for a class project. Which choice shows the BEST way for him to conduct a short research project that builds knowledge about this topic?

answer_options.A: Draw a picture of a rainforest animal from memory without looking up any facts.
answer_options.B: Read one article about rainforest animals and copy a sentence from it word for word.
answer_options.C: Read two books about rainforest animals, visit a nature website, and write notes about what the animals eat and where they live.
answer_options.D: Ask his friend what they know about rainforests and use only that information for the project.

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because it shows Marcus using multiple reliable sources (two books and a website) and taking organized notes on specific details. These steps are key parts of conducting a short research project that builds knowledge about a topic.
subject: ELA

question: A student is writing a report about rabbits. She gathered these notes from books and websites. Which note belongs in the "Habitat" category?

answer_options.A: Rabbits eat grass, vegetables, and hay.
answer_options.B: Rabbits live in fields, forests, and meadows.
answer_options.C: Rabbits have long ears and soft fur.
answer_options.D: Rabbits can run very fast to escape danger.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because the note describes where rabbits live, which fits the 'Habitat' category. The standard W.3.8 includes sorting evidence into provided categories, and this note about living spaces correctly belongs under 'Habitat.'
subject: ELA

question:
A student is researching why animals are endangered. She has:

Personal experience: 'I saw a sea turtle with plastic around its neck at the beach.'

Book: 'Tigers lose their homes when forests are cut down. Elephants are hunted for their ivory tusks.'

Website: 'Polar bears struggle because ice is melting. Rhinos are poached for their horns.'

Categories: 1) Habitat Loss 2) Hunting/Poaching 3) Pollution

Which choice shows notes that follow W.3.8 by taking brief notes, identifying sources, and sorting ALL evidence correctly?

answer_options.A: Personal: Sea turtle with plastic (Pollution). Book: Tigers lose homes (Habitat Loss); Elephants hunted for ivory (Hunting). Website: Polar bears, ice melting (Habitat Loss); Rhinos poached (Hunting).
answer_options.B: Personal: Sea turtle with plastic (Habitat Loss). Book: Tigers lose homes (Habitat Loss); Elephants hunted for ivory (Hunting). Website: Polar bears, ice melting (Pollution); Rhinos poached (Hunting).
answer_options.C: 'I saw a sea turtle with plastic around its neck at the beach' (Pollution). Book: Tigers lose homes (Habitat Loss); Elephants hunted (Hunting). Website: Polar bears struggle (Habitat Loss); Rhinos poached (Hunting).
answer_options.D: Sea turtle with plastic (Pollution); Tigers lose homes (Habitat Loss); Elephants hunted for ivory (Hunting); Polar bears, ice melting (Habitat Loss); Rhinos poached (Hunting).

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it takes brief notes (not copied word-for-word), identifies each source (Personal, Book, Website), and sorts all evidence correctly: sea turtle with plastic is Pollution, tigers losing homes and polar bears with melting ice are Habitat Loss, and elephants hunted for ivory and rhinos poached are Hunting/Poaching.
subject: ELA

question:
Emma is writing a report about how animals stay safe. She gathered information from different places and wrote these notes:

1. "Some animals use camouflage to blend in with their surroundings." (Animal Survival book, page 12)
2. "Porcupines have sharp quills that protect them from other animals." (WildlifeWatch.org)
3. "I saw a rabbit freeze and stay very still when a dog came near." (My own observation)

Her teacher gave her two categories: "Hiding or Staying Still" and "Using Body Parts for Defense."

Which option shows the best way for Emma to sort her notes into the given categories?

answer_options.A: Put note 1 in "Hiding or Staying Still" and notes 2 and 3 in "Using Body Parts for Defense."
answer_options.B: Put notes 1 and 3 in "Hiding or Staying Still" and note 2 in "Using Body Parts for Defense."
answer_options.C: Put all three notes in "Hiding or Staying Still."
answer_options.D: Put note 3 in "Using Body Parts for Defense" and notes 1 and 2 in "Hiding or Staying Still."

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because note 1 describes camouflage, which is a way of hiding, and note 3 describes a rabbit staying very still to avoid danger. Both belong in "Hiding or Staying Still." Note 2 describes porcupine quills, which are body parts used for defense, so it belongs in "Using Body Parts for Defense." This shows Emma correctly sorted notes from a book, a website, and her own experience into the provided categories.
subject: ELA
